They have three children.<ref>[http://www.naij.com/tag/655-tb-joshua.html] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141230014559/http://www.naij.com/tag/655-tb-joshua.html|date=December 30, 2014}}</ref> His eldest daughter Serah Joshua is a graduate from the [[London School of Economics]], Department of Law.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nigeriafilms.com/news/18196/20/tb-joshuas-daughter-graduates-from-london-school-o.html |title=Tb Joshuas Daughter Graduates From London School Of Economics |publisher=nigeriafilms.com |date= |accessdate=2015-07-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150715103708/http://www.nigeriafilms.com/news/18196/20/tb-joshuas-daughter-graduates-from-london-school-o.html |archivedate=2015-07-15 |df= }}</ref> and was '[[called to the bar]]' in Nigeria in December 2015.<ref>{{Cite news| first = Gregory| last = Nwakunor| title = Behold, Prophet TB Joshua’s Daughter, Serah| url = http://www.ngrguardiannews.com/2015/12/behold-prophet-tb-joshuas-daughter-serah/ | work = The Guardian (Nigeria)| date = 2015-12-19}}</ref> His second daughter, Promise Joshua, is studying Politics and International Relations at the [[London School of Economics]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.saharaweeklyng.com/tb-joshua-family-specialyes-i-have-been-called-to-bar-in-new-york-tb-joshuas-22-year-old-daughter-sarah-the-spiritual-cover-i-enjoy-is-unquantifiable-promise-18-year-old-undergraduate-daughter/|title=TB Joshua Family Special|last=|first=|date=|website=Sahara Weekly|publisher=|access-date=May 27, 2016}}</ref>

{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox MP | name = Tin Pei Ling | native_name = 陈佩玲 | image = | caption = | constituency_MP1 = [[MacPherson Single Member Constituency|MacPherson SMC]] | parliament1 = Singapore | term_start1 = 11 September 2015 | term_end1 = | constituency_MP2 = [[Marine Parade Group Representation Constituency|Marine Parade GRC]] | parliament2 = Singapore | term_start2 = 7 May 2011 | term_end2 = 24 August 2015 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|12|23|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Singapore]] | death_date = | death_place = | restingplace = | restingplacecoordinates = | nationality = Singaporean | party = [[People's Action Party]] | spouse = Ng How Yue | relations = | children = Ng Kee Hau | residence = | alma_mater = [[National University of Singapore]] | occupation = Politician | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} {{Chinese name|[[Chen (surname)|Tin]]}} '''Tin Pei Ling''' ({{zh|t=陳佩玲|s=陈佩玲|p=Chén Pèilíng}}; born 23 December 1983{{cite web|url=http://www.parliament.gov.sg/mp/tin-pei-ling?viewcv=Tin%20Pei%20Ling|title=Parliament of Singapore : MP Tin Pei Ling's CV|access-date=10 February 2015|website=Parliament of Singapore |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130522011336/http://www.parliament.gov.sg/mp/tin-pei-ling?viewcv=Tin%20Pei%20Ling|archivedate=22 May 2013}}) is a Singaporean [[People's Action Party]] (PAP) Member of Parliament (MP) in the [[MacPherson Single Member Constituency]].{{cite web|url=http://www.pap.org.sg/uploads/ap/8051/documents/tin_pei_ling_cv.pdf |title=Tin Pei Ling CV, PAP|access-date=28 March 2011}}{{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/5yVoihtLL?url=http://www.pap.org.sg/uploads/ap/8051/documents/tin_pei_ling_cv.pdf |date=7 May 2011 }} Besides being the youngest MP in Parliament, Tin was also the PAP's youngest candidate in the [[Singapore general election, 2011]]. She is currently serving as the Chairperson of the Ulu Pandan Youth Executive Committee for the [[Young PAP]] (YPAP),{{cite web|title=Young PAP 17th Executive Committee|url=http://www.youngpap.org.sg/about/executive-committee/|website=Young PAP web|accessdate=1 July 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110705210757/http://www.youngpap.org.sg/about/executive-committee/|archivedate=5 July 2011|df=}} the PAP's youth wing, and a member of the Community Development Welfare Fund Committee. Tin is married to Ng How Yue, Second Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Trade and Industry and formerly a Principal Private Secretary to Prime Minister [[Lee Hsien Loong]].{{cite news|title=Straight fight in Marine Parade GRC between PAP and NSP|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_661750.html|accessdate=6 July 2011|newspaper=[[Straits Times]]|date=27 April 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110807234605/http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_661750.html|archive-date=2011-08-07|dead-url=no|df=}} Tin Pei Ling has a baby that was born on 5 August 2015, and was named Ng Kee Hau. ==Background== {{expand section|date=January 2015}} Tin attended [[Crescent Girls' School]] and [[Hwa Chong Junior College]] during her adolescent years. She attended the [[National University of Singapore]] to major in psychology.{{cite web | url=http://news.pap.org.sg/young-pap/advisors_tinpeiling.html | title=Tin Pei Ling | publisher=[[Young PAP]] | accessdate=14 September 2015 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151110213020/http://news.pap.org.sg/young-pap/advisors_tinpeiling.html | archivedate=10 November 2015 | df= }} Prior to the formation of the 17th Young PAP Executive Committee marked by the 2011 elections, Tin was formerly assistant treasurer for Young PAP and a representative for the [[Ulu Pandan Single Member Constituency|Ulu Pandan]] branch.{{cite web|title=Young PAP 16th Executive Committee|url=http://www.pap.org.sg/uploads/ap/3908/documents/yp_16th_exco_poster.pdf|website=Young PAP web|accessdate=3 May 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110516080312/http://www.pap.org.sg/uploads/ap/3908/documents/yp_16th_exco_poster.pdf|archivedate=16 May 2011|df=}} ==Career== ===2011 general election=== In the [[Singapore general election, 2011|2011 general election]], Tin was selected as a candidate for the [[Marine Parade Group Representation Constituency|Marine Parade GRC]] alongside former prime minister [[Goh Chok Tong]] among others. Having been a member of the Ulu Pandan branch of the Young PAP for 7 years, she was fielded by the PAP as a candidate to attract the "unpredictable" youth vote through social networking sites.{{cite news|last=Russell|first=Jon|title=Nicole Seah and the social media effect|url=http://www.asiasentinel.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=3152&Itemid=181|accessdate=1 May 2011|newspaper=[[Asia Sentinel]]|date=27 April 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110430085208/http://www.asiasentinel.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=3152&Itemid=181|archive-date=2011-04-30|dead-url=no|df=}} On election day, the PAP took Marine Parade GRC with 56.65% of the votes, defeating [[National Solidarity Party (Singapore)|National Solidarity Party]]'s team led by Cheo Chai Chen{{cite news|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_666063.html|title=PAP takes Marine Parade|date=8 May 2011|newspaper=The Straits Times (Singapore)|access-date=2011-07-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724043414/http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_666063.html|archive-date=2011-07-24|dead-url=no|df=}} Goh Chok Tong admitted after the election that Tin's youth and negative image perceived by the public was a "factor" for the People's Action Party's weaker performance this election compared to their 72.9% win in 1992.{{cite web|title=GE: Tin Pei Ling "a factor" for weak results, says SM Goh|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1127545/1/.html|website=Channel News Asia|date=8 May 2011|accessdate=8 May 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110510010922/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1127545/1/.html|archive-date=2011-05-10|dead-url=no|df=}} On 1 June 2011, Tin announced on her [[Facebook]] account that she had resigned from her Senior Associate position in [[Ernst & Young]], where she had worked for four years.{{cite web |url=http://ge.pap.org.sg/candidate/tinpeiling |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-02-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130114073042/http://ge.pap.org.sg/candidate/tinpeiling |archivedate=2013-01-14 |df= }} She said the decision was made in order to focus on her responsibilities as full-time MP in her MacPherson ward and the Marine Parade GRC.{{cite news|title=MP Tin Pei Ling resigns from Ernst & Young|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/BreakingNews/Singapore/Story/STIStory_674920.html|accessdate=1 June 2011|newspaper=[[Straits Times]]|date=1 June 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110603053239/http://www.straitstimes.com/BreakingNews/Singapore/Story/STIStory_674920.html|archive-date=2011-06-03|dead-url=no|df=}} Tin's selection as a candidate for Parliament in 2011 resulted in a large online backlash, especially amongst young Singaporeans. Throughout the campaign, Tin garnered negative attention due to her perceived immaturity to become an MP,{{cite web |url=http://sg.news.yahoo.com/blogs/singaporescene/conscience-clear-tin-pei-ling-20110414-001731-974.html |title=My conscience is clear: Tin Pei Ling |accessdate=7 May 2011 |author=Alicia Wong |date=14 April 2011 |website= |publisher=Yahoo Singapore |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5yVndaHKj?url=http://sg.news.yahoo.com/blogs/singaporescene/conscience-clear-tin-pei-ling-20110414-001731-974.html |archivedate=7 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }} and allusions were also raised as to how her husband's position had opened doors for her into politics.{{cite web | access-date=2011-07-06 | archive-date=2011-08-07 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110807234605/http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_661750.html | url=http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_661750.html/ | title=Straight fight in Marine Parade GRC between PAP and NSP | dead-url=no}} A widely circulated Facebook photo of Tin posing with a [[Kate Spade New York|Kate Spade]]-branded gift from her husband, also led to widespread accusations online of [[ignorance]], [[materialism]] and privilege.{{cite news|title=PAP's youngest candidate faces online criticism|url=http://www.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne%2BNews/Singapore/Story/A1Story20110331-271039.html|accessdate=1 May 2011|date=31 March 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110403034459/http://www.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne+News/Singapore/Story/A1Story20110331-271039.html|archive-date=2011-04-03|dead-url=no|df=}} When asked if there was a policy she would change, she replied that there were no policy that she felt strongly against.{{cite web|last=Ting|first=Victoria|title=Tin Pei Ling: New blood or bad blood?|url=http://veryfinecommentary.tk/articles/tin-pei-ling-new-blood-bad-blood/|website=Very Fine Commentary|accessdate=1 May 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110425043148/http://veryfinecommentary.tk/articles/tin-pei-ling-new-blood-bad-blood/|archivedate=25 April 2011|df=}}{{verify credibility|date=May 2011}} When asked what her "greatest regret" was, she said it was not having brought her (still living) parents to [[Universal Studios Singapore]].{{cite web|title=Video: Tin Pei Ling's greatest regret|url=http://www.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne%2BNews/Singapore/Story/A1Story20110331-271047.html|access-date=2011-05-02|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110403035423/http://www.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne+News/Singapore/Story/A1Story20110331-271047.html|archive-date=2011-04-03|dead-url=no|df=}} Some Singaporeans were concerned that as an "undeserving [candidate]," Tin had a high chance of being elected "not on [her] own merit, but rather on the back of established MPs" since the 5-member PAP team would be voted in or rejected as a group under Singapore's [[Group Representative Constituency]] system.{{cite news |title=Online petition against PAP’s Tin Pei Ling |url=http://sg.news.yahoo.com/blogs/singaporescene/online-petition-against-pap-tin-pei-ling-20110405-092443-518.html;_ylt=Akep0qaf6elwzcYgY9540bz9Vsd_;_ylu=X3oDMTBwcWVpbGxsBHBvcwMxMQRzZWMDTWVkaWFCbG9nSW5kZXg-;_ylg=X3oDMTFjaTBvcG51BGludGwDc2cEbGFuZwNlbi1zZwRwc3RhaWQDBHB0A3NlY3Rpb25zBHRlc3QD;_ylv=3 |work=Yahoo! News |date=6 April 2011 |last=Sim |first=Fann |accessdate=1 July 2011}} The public's online hostility towards Tin was so great that [[Goh Chok Tong]] defended her in the press. He said he had taken Tin in when Prime Minister [[Lee Hsien Loong]] had offered her to be fielded as a candidate in his GRC. He had accepted her as he did not think Tin was a weak candidate. He dismissed the online criticisms as "distortion" and even though "some sound bites of her which pitted her as a rather light-weight person", it was just "a superficial view". He still believed that she "would work very hard", "[could] reach out to the young, and the not so young," that he "would like her to do more to help the old people in MacPherson," and that she would become "a good MP in due course".{{cite news|last=Siow|first=Maria|title=GE: SM Goh defends quality of new PAP candidates|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1123539/1/.html|accessdate=18 April 2011|date=4 May 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110419195620/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1123539/1/.html|archive-date=2011-04-19|dead-url=no|df=}} [[Nicole Seah]] from the [[National Solidarity Party (Singapore)|National Solidarity Party]] (NSP) team in [[Marine Parade GRC]] filed a complaint to the [[Elections Department]] on 6 May 2011, stating that Tin had violated the state-mandated cooling-off period 24 hours before polls by posting a Facebook comment on Seah crying during her walkabout. Under the Singapore Parliamentary Elections Act,{{Singapore legislation| cap = 218 | title = Parliamentary Elections Act | ed = 2007}} canvassing on Polling Day and Cooling Off Day is prohibited and the offence carries a fine or imprisonment or both. When questioned, Tin replied that one of her administrators, Denise He, had posted the comment under her account and that He had meant to post in her own capacity from her phone, but had forgotten to log out of Tin's account.{{cite news|title=Nicole Seah files complaint against Tin Pei Ling|url=http://news.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne%2BNews/Singapore/Story/A1Story20110507-277654.html|accessdate=7 May 2011|newspaper=[[AsiaOne]]|date=7 May 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110510140436/http://news.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne+News/Singapore/Story/A1Story20110507-277654.html|archive-date=2011-05-10|dead-url=no|df=}} The NSP team was advised by the Elections Department to file a police report before the Elections Department could investigate.{{cite news|title=NSP advised to make police report|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_665908.html|accessdate=7 May 2011|newspaper=[[Straits Times]]|date=7 May 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110509184052/http://www.straitstimes.com/GeneralElection/News/Story/STIStory_665908.html|archive-date=2011-05-09|dead-url=no|df=}} The police confirmed that a report was lodged against her.{{cite news|title=Police report lodged against Tin Pei Ling over cooling-off day complaint|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1129239/1/.html|accessdate=16 May 2011|newspaper=[[Channel News Asia]]|date=16 May 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110518011501/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1129239/1/.html|archive-date=2011-05-18|dead-url=no|df=}} The police issued a stern warning to Tin as well as Seah, who also had a similar complaint lodged against her.{{cite news|title=No police action against Tin Pei Ling, Nicole Seah|url=http://sg.news.yahoo.com/blogs/singaporescene/no-police-action-again-tin-pei-ling-nicole-155735325.html|accessdate=14 August 2012|newspaper=[[Yahoo]]|date=14 August 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812121357/https://sg.news.yahoo.com/blogs/singaporescene/no-police-action-again-tin-pei-ling-nicole-155735325.html|archive-date=2014-08-12|dead-url=no|df=}} ===2015 general election=== In the [[Singaporean general election, 2015|2015 Singaporean general election]], [[MacPherson SMC]] was split from Marine Parade GRC for the first time since the [[Singaporean general election, 2006|2006 elections]].{{cite web | url=http://www.straitstimes.com/politics/singapolitics/tin-pei-ling-goes-from-rocky-start-to-running-solo-in-macpherson | title=Tin Pei Ling goes from rocky start to running solo in MacPherson | accessdate=14 September 2015 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150824190621/http://www.straitstimes.com/politics/singapolitics/tin-pei-ling-goes-from-rocky-start-to-running-solo-in-macpherson | archive-date=2015-08-24 | dead-url=no | df= }} She ran against Bernard Chen of the [[Workers' Party of Singapore|Workers' Party]] and [[Cheo Chai Chen]] of the [[National Solidarity Party (Singapore)|National Solidarity Party]].{{cite web | url=http://www.straitstimes.com/politics/ge2015-three-cornered-fight-for-macpherson-smc-between-pap-wp-and-nsp | title=GE2015: Three-cornered fight for MacPherson SMC between PAP, WP and NSP | accessdate=14 September 2015 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150921010452/http://www.straitstimes.com/politics/ge2015-three-cornered-fight-for-macpherson-smc-between-pap-wp-and-nsp | archive-date=2015-09-21 | dead-url=no | df= }} Cheo's campaign suffered a major blunder when he described Tin's new role as a mother as "her weakness" in the campaign.{{cite web | url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/specialreports/sgvotes2015/latest/tin-pei-ling-s-new-status/2100462.html | title=Tin Pei Ling's new status as a mum is a weakness: Cheo | publisher=[[Channel NewsAsia]] | date=4 September 2015 | accessdate=14 September 2015 | author=Yi, Hon Jing | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150912160214/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/specialreports/sgvotes2015/latest/tin-pei-ling-s-new-status/2100462.html | archive-date=2015-09-12 | dead-url=no | df= }} Facing public backlash, Cheo later claimed that this comment was meant as a joke.{{cite web | url=http://news.asiaone.com/news/general-election/pap-wins-macpherson-656-cent-votes | title=PAP wins MacPherson with 65.6 per cent of votes | publisher=[[Singapore Press Holdings]] | website=[[AsiaOne]] | date=12 September 2015 | accessdate=14 September 2015 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150914065927/http://news.asiaone.com/news/general-election/pap-wins-macpherson-656-cent-votes | archive-date=2015-09-14 | dead-url=no | df= }} She received 17,227 votes, or 65.58% of the total, compared to Chen's 33.6% and Cheo's 0.82%.{{cite web | url=http://www.straitstimes.com/politics/ge2015-paps-candidates-leading-in-three-cornered-fights-after-sample-count | title=GE2015: All three-cornered fights won by PAP candidates | publisher=[[Singapore Press Holdings]] | website=[[The Straits Times]] | date=11 September 2015 | accessdate=14 September 2015 | author=Chen, May | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150914230805/http://www.straitstimes.com/politics/ge2015-paps-candidates-leading-in-three-cornered-fights-after-sample-count | archive-date=2015-09-14 | {{Infobox person | name = Václav Holek | image = Václav Holek (1886-1954).jpg | image_size = 200 px | alt = | caption = Václav Holek | native_name = | native_name_lang = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1886|9|24|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Dobev|Malé Nepodřice]], [[Kingdom of Bohemia|Bohemia]], [[Austria-Hungary]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1954|12|13|1886|4|24|df=yes}} | death_place = [[Brno]], [[Czechoslovakia]] | occupation = [[firearm]] [[engineer]] | years_active = 1905–1950 | known_for = Designing of weapons | notable_works = [[Bren light machine gun]]
[[Besa machine gun]] }} '''Václav Holek''' (24 September 1886, Malé Nepodřice{{cite web|url=http://digi.ceskearchivy.cz/cs/6388/257|author=Martin Hankovec|publisher=digi.ceskearchivy.cz|title=DigiArchiv SOA v Třeboni - ver. 16.11.11 | Parish register on birth and christening |accessdate=2016-11-18}} – 13 November 1954, [[Brno]]) was a Czech [[firearm]] engineer. He is considered to be the most eminent [[weapon]]s designer of the pre-war [[Czechoslovakia]]. He had applied for more than 75 patents during his active years. == Life == Václav Holek was born in a village of Malé Nepodřice, southern [[Bohemia]], in 1886. He completed his apprenticeship as a [[gunsmith]] and studied afterwards in the town of [[Písek]]. In 1905 he started working with an Anton Mulacz company in [[Vienna]], from 1910 he had acquired a job with the gunsmith Jan Nowotný in [[Prague]], where he took part in refining of [[Holland & Holland]] system [[shotgun]]s. During [[World War I]] the company produced [[Artillery|artillery guns]] for the [[Austro-Hungarian Army]]. In 1918 Holek switched to the Zbrojovka Praga, a firearm company newly established by the son of Holek’s former boss Jan Nowotný. Here a service [[semi-automatic pistol]] designated for the [[Czechoslovak Army]] and police designed by Holek came into existence. And it was here where, in the spring time of 1921, Václav Holek constructed a [[light machine gun]] from which the Czechoslovak Army light machine gun PRAGA vz. 24 was born, the predecessor of the [[ZB vz. 26]] light machine gun. (Later, British [[Royal Small Arms Factory]] of [[London Borough of Enfield|Enfield]] bought the [[license]] and produced some 220,000 of those guns marked as [[Bren light machine gun|Bren]].) In December 1924 Holek switched to the [[Zbrojovka Brno|Československá zbrojovka in Brno]], where, in the 1930s, he developed the [[ZB-53]] [[machine gun]], of which 60.000 pieces marked as [[Besa machine gun]] were produced in Britain. During [[World War II]] and in the post-war years Václav Holek developed a number of modern semi-automatic weapons out of which only the [[Vz. 52 machine gun|Vz. 52 light machine gun]] saw the production line. == References == == Literature == * Lubomir Popelinský: ''Československé automatické zbraně'' (Czechoslovak automatic weapons), Prague 1999 {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Holek, Václav}} [[Category:1886 births]] [[Category:1954 deaths]] [[Category:Czech engineers]] [[Category:Firearm designers]]

{{Infobox person | name = William Binney | image = File:William Binney-IMG 9040.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Binney at the Congress on Privacy & Surveillance (2013) of the [[École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne|École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL)]] | birth_name = William Edward Binney | birth_place = [[Pennsylvania]], U.S. | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1943|9}} | death_place = | death_cause = | education = [[Pennsylvania State University]] {{small|(B.S., 1970)}} | occupation = Cryptanalyst-mathematician | employer = National Security Agency (NSA) | known_for = [[Cryptography]], [[Signals intelligence|SIGINT]] analysis, [[whistleblower|whistleblowing]] | religion = | denomination = | criminal_charge = | criminal_penalty = | criminal_status = | spouse = | awards = {{flatlist| * [[Meritorious Civilian Service Award]] * [[Joe A. Callaway Award for Civic Courage]] (2012){{cite web | url = http://www.callawayawards.org/for-immediate-release-callaway-awards-tuesday-oct-30/ | title=For Immediate Release: Callaway Awards Tuesday November 13, 2012 | accessdate=2013-07-01 | date=2012-11-13 | publisher=The Joe A. Callaway Award for Civic Justice}} * [[Sam Adams Award]] (2015){{cite web|author1=Hannah Borno|title=NSA whistleblower William Binney wins 2015 Sam Adams award|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/nsa-whistleblower-william-binney-wins-2015-sam-adams-award-1484867|website=International Business Times|accessdate=31 August 2015|date=23 January 2015}} }} | signature = William Binney-signature.jpg }} '''William Edward Binney'''Video-Interview by {{cite web | url = http://lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/vhp/bib/81914 | title=William Edward Binney Collection | accessdate=2013-06-29 | author= Thomas Drake | date=2011-10-26 | work=Veterans History Project | publisher=American Folklife Center of the [[Library of Congress]] | format=Video; 25 Min}} is a former highly placed intelligence official with the United States [[National Security Agency]] (NSA){{cite web |title= Three NSA Whistleblowers Back EFF's Lawsuit Over Government's Massive Spying Program |publisher= Electronic Frontier Foundation |date= July 2, 2012 |url= https://www.eff.org/press/releases/three-nsa-whistleblowers-back-effs-lawsuit-over-governments-massive-spying-program |accessdate= May 11, 2013 }} turned [[whistleblower]] who retired on October 31, 2001, after more than 30 years with the agency. He was a high-profile critic of his former employers during the [[George W. Bush]] administration, and later criticized the NSA's data collection policies during the Barack Obama administration. In 2016, Binney said the U.S. intelligence community's assessment that Russia interfered in the 2016 presidential election was false, but on close examination of the documents that purported to prove a British origin of the hacking, could not prove the data was downloaded from the [[Democratic National Committee]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.computerweekly.com/news/252445769/Briton-ran-pro-Kremlin-disinformation-campaign-that-helped-Trump-deny-Russian-links|title=Briton ran pro-Kremlin disinformation campaign that helped Trump deny Russian links|work=ComputerWeekly.com|access-date=2018-08-01|language=en-GB}} == Biography == Binney grew up in rural Pennsylvania and graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in mathematics from the [[Pennsylvania State University]] in 1970. He said that he volunteered for the Army during the [[Vietnam War|Vietnam era]] in order to select work that would interest him rather than [[Conscription|be drafted]] and have no input. He was found to have strong aptitudes for [[mathematics]], [[analysis]], and [[Cryptanalysis|code breaking]],{{cite web|url=http://www.hopenumbernine.net/schedule/#binney|title=Keynote Address: William Binney|year=2012|work=Schedule – HOPE Number Nine|publisher=2600 Enterprises|accessdate=May 11, 2013}} and served from 1965 to 1969 in the [[United States Army Security Agency|Army Security Agency]] before going to the NSA in 1970. Binney was a Russia specialist and worked in the operations side of intelligence, starting as an analyst and ending as a [[Technical director|Technical Director]] prior to becoming a geopolitical world Technical Director. In the 1990s, he co-founded a unit on automating signals intelligence with NSA research chief Dr. John Taggart.{{cite web | url = http://civic.mit.edu/blog/schock/the-government-is-profiling-you-william-binney-former-nsa |title=The Government Is Profiling You |work=MIT Center for Internet and Society |date=November 12, 2012 |accessdate=June 8, 2013}} Binney's NSA career culminated as Technical Leader for intelligence in 2001. He has expertise in [[intelligence analysis]], [[traffic analysis]], [[systems analysis]], [[knowledge management]], and mathematics (including [[set theory]], [[number theory]], and [[probability]]).{{cite web|url=https://publicintelligence.net/binney-nsa-declaration/|title=Sworn Declaration of Whistleblower William Binney on NSA Domestic Surveillance Capabilities|date=July 16, 2012|publisher=Public Intelligence|accessdate=May 11, 2013}} After retiring from the NSA, he founded, together with fellow NSA whistleblower [[J. Kirk Wiebe]], Entity Mapping, LLC, a [[private intelligence agency]] to market their analysis program to government agencies.{{cite web | work = Government Accountability Project website | title = NSA Whistleblowers William (Bill) Binney and J. Kirk Wiebe | url = http://www.whistleblower.org/program-areas/homeland-security-a-human-rights/surveillance/nsa-whistleblowers-bill-binney-a-j-kirk-wiebe | accessdate = June 9, 2013 }} Kirk Wiebe and William Binney "have started a company (Pretty Good Knowledge{{cite web | work = prettygoodknowledge.eu website | title = Massive Data Analysis| url = https://prettygoodknowledge.eu/ |accessdate = February 10, 2018}}) with partners in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, to resurrect and do the kinds of smart things we thought we do with data back in the 1990s, because this government and the Deep State as well as the shadow government didn't want us doing that here. So we're over there doing this."{{cite web | work = acamedia.info | title = NSA Whistleblower Bill Binney, and His Ordeal| url = http://acamedia.info/politics/surveillance/references/NSA_Whistleblower_Bill_Binney,_and_His_Ordeal.html |accessdate = February 10, 2018}} == Whistleblowing == [[File:William Binney, in offices of Democracy Now! in New York City, 4 May 2012..jpg|thumb|left|Binney sitting in the offices of ''Democracy Now!'' in New York City on May 2012, prior to appearing with hosts [[Amy Goodman]], [[Juan Gonzalez (journalist)|Juan Gonzalez]], and guest [[Jacob Appelbaum]]. Photo taken by Appelbaum.]] {{NSA surveillance}} In September 2002, he, along with [[J. Kirk Wiebe]] and [[Edward Loomis]], asked the [[United States Department of Defense|U.S. Defense Department]] [[Office of the Inspector General, U.S. Department of Defense|Inspector General]] (DoD IG) to investigate the NSA for allegedly wasting "millions and millions of dollars" on [[Trailblazer Project|Trailblazer]], a system intended to analyze mass collection of data carried on communications networks such as the Internet. Binney had been one of the inventors of an alternative system, [[ThinThread]], which was shelved when Trailblazer was chosen instead. Binney has also been publicly critical of the NSA for spying on U.S. citizens, saying of its expanded [[NSA electronic surveillance program|surveillance]] after the [[September 11 attacks|September 11, 2001 attacks]] that "it's better than anything that the [[KGB]], the [[Stasi]], or the [[Gestapo]] and [[Schutzstaffel|SS]] ever had"{{cite journal |last= Shorrock |first= Tim |authorlink= Tim Shorrock |title= The Untold Story: Obama's Crackdown on Whistleblowers: The NSA Four reveal how a toxic mix of cronyism and fraud blinded the agency before 9/11 |journal= The Nation |date= April 15, 2013 |url= http://www.thenation.com/article/173521/obamas-crackdown-whistleblowers }} as well as noting Trailblazer's ineffectiveness and unjustified high cost compared to the far less intrusive ThinThread.{{cite web | title = NSA Whistleblowers William (Bill) Binney and J. Kirk Wiebe |publisher= Government Accountability Project |url= http://www.whistleblower.org/program-areas/homeland-security-a-human-rights/surveillance/nsa-whistleblowers-bill-binney-a-j-kirk-wiebe |accessdate= May 11, 2013 }} He was furious that the NSA hadn't uncovered the 9/11 plot and stated that intercepts it had collected but not analyzed likely would have garnered timely attention with his leaner more focused system.{{cite journal |last= Mayer |first= Jane |authorlink= Jane Mayer |title= The Secret Sharer: Is Thomas Drake an enemy of the state? |journal= The New Yorker |date= May 23, 2011 |url= http://www.newyorker.com/reporting/2011/05/23/110523fa_fact_mayer?currentPage=all }} === After the NSA === After he left the NSA in 2001, Binney was one of several people investigated as part of an inquiry into a 2005 ''[[The New York Times]]'' exposé on the agency’s [[NSA warrantless surveillance controversy|warrantless eavesdropping program]].{{citation needed|date=November 2017}} Binney was cleared of wrongdoing after three interviews with [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] agents beginning in March 2007, but in early July 2007, in an unannounced, armed, early morning raid, a dozen agents armed with rifles appeared at his house, one of whom entered the bathroom and pointed his gun at Binney, who was taking a shower. The FBI confiscated a desktop computer, disks, and personal and business records.{{cite web|title=Exclusive: National Security Agency Whistleblower William Binney on Growing State Surveillance|url=http://www.democracynow.org/2012/4/20/exclusive_national_security_agency_whistleblower_william|website=Democracy Now!|accessdate=23 September 2016}}{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} The NSA revoked his [[security clearance]], forcing him to close a business he ran with former colleagues at a loss of a reported $300,000 in annual income. The FBI raided the homes of Wiebe and Loomis, as well as [[United States House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence|House Intelligence Committee]] staffer [[Diane Roark]], the same morning. Several months later the FBI raided the home of then still active NSA executive [[Thomas Andrews Drake]] who had also contacted DoD IG, but anonymously with confidentiality assured. The Assistant Inspector General, [[John Crane (government official)|John Crane]], in charge of the [[Department of Defense Whistleblower Program|Whistleblower Program]], suspecting his superiors provided confidential information to the [[United States Department of Justice]] (DOJ), challenged them, was eventually forced from his position, and subsequently himself became a public whistleblower. The punitive treatment of Binney, Drake, and the other whistleblowers also led [[Edward Snowden]] to go public with his revelations rather than report through the internal whistleblower program.{{cite news |last = Hertsgaard |first = Mark |last2 = Kasten |first2 = Felix |last3 = Rosenbach |first3 = Marcel |last4 = Stark |first4 = Holger |title = Blowing the Whistle: Former US Official Reveals Risks Faced by Internal Critics |newspaper = Der Spiegel |pages = |language = English |date = 22 May 2016 |url = http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/ex-us-official-reveals-risks-faced-by-internal-govt-critics-a-1093360.html |access-date = 2016-06-16 }} In 2012, Binney and his co-plaintiffs went to federal court to retrieve the confiscated items.{{cite news |last = Bronner |first = Ethan |author2=Charlie Savage |author3=Scott Shane |title = Leak Inquiries Show How Wide A Net U.S. Cast |newspaper = The New York Times |date = May 25, 2013 |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/26/us/leaks-inquiries-show-how-wide-a-net-is-cast.html?_r=0 }} === Allegations on intercepts === Binney is known for making the claim that the NSA collects and stores information about every U.S. communication.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/nsa-critic-bill-binney-says-trump-pushed-meeting-cia-s-n818306|title=Was Donald Trump behind meeting of CIA chief and conspiracy theorist?|work=NBC News|access-date=2017-11-09|language=en}} Binney was invited as a witness by the [[German Parliamentary Committee investigating the NSA spying scandal|NSA commission]] of the German [[Bundestag]]. On July 3, 2014 ''[[Der Spiegel]]'' wrote, he said that the NSA wanted to have information about everything. In Binney's view this is a [[Totalitarianism|totalitarian]] approach, which had previously been seen only in dictatorships.{{cite news|title=Untersuchungsausschuss im Bundestag: US-Informant vergleicht NSA mit einer Diktatur |url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/william-binney-als-zeuge-im-nsa-untersuchungsausschuss-a-979062.html|accessdate=4 July 2014|work=Spiegel|publisher=Spiegelonline GmbH|date=3 July 2014}} Binney stated that the goal was to control people. Meanwhile, he said that it is possible in principle to monitor the whole population, abroad and in the U.S., which in his view contradicts the [[United States Constitution]]. In August 2014 Binney was among the signatories of an open letter by the group [[Veteran Intelligence Professionals for Sanity]] to German chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] in which they urged the Chancellor to be suspicious of U.S. intelligence regarding the alleged invasion of Russia in Eastern Ukraine.[http://www.tagesspiegel.de/politik/ukraine-und-russland-us-geheimdienst-pensionaere-warnen-merkel-vor-fehlinformationen/10655758.html "US-Geheimdienst-Pensionäre warnen Merkel vor Fehlinformationen", Der Tagesspiegel (in German), September 4, 2014] In the open letter, the group said:
[A]ccusations of a major Russian "invasion" of Ukraine appear not to be supported by reliable intelligence. Rather, the "intelligence" seems to be of the same dubious, politically "fixed" kind used 12 years ago to "justify" the U.S.-led attack on Iraq.
=== Russian Interference in the 2016 election === {{see|Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections}} Binney claims the U.S. intelligence community's assessment that Russia interfered in the 2016 presidential election is false, and that the [[Democratic National Committee]] e-mails were leaked by an insider instead.{{Cite web|url=https://theintercept.com/2017/11/07/dnc-hack-trump-cia-director-william-binney-nsa/|title=CIA Director Met Advocate of Disputed DNC Hack Theory — at Trump’s Request|last=Campbell|first=Duncan|last2=Risen|first2=James|date=2017-11-07|website=The Intercept|language=en-US|access-date=2017-11-07}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/sean-hannity-wikileaks-conspiracy-theory-cia-hacked-2017-3?r=US&IR=T|title=Conservative media figures are embracing a wild WikiLeaks conspiracy theory that the CIA hacked the DNC, and then framed Russia|work=Business Insider|access-date=2017-11-07|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/view/articles/2017-08-10/why-some-u-s-ex-spies-don-t-buy-the-russia-story|title=Why Some U.S. Ex-Spies Don't Buy the Russia Story|date=2017-08-10|work=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2017-11-07}} He has appeared on Fox News at least ten times between September 2016 and November 2017 to promote this theory. Binney said that the "intelligence community wasn’t being honest here". He has also been frequently cited on Breitbart News. In November 2017 it was reported that a month earlier, Binney had met with CIA Director Mike Pompeo at the behest of President Trump. ===Role in apparent release of the Nunes Memo=== On January 23, 2018, Binney made an appearance on the [[Infowars]] news programhttps://www.infowars.com/exclusive-infowars-releases-secret-fisa-memo/ in connection with the [[Nunes memo]], a Congressional document alleging irregularities in the application of the [[FISA|FISA Act]], which at that time was not publicly available although its potential release was a topic of public debate.https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2018/02/04/trump-twitter-russians-release-the-memo-216935 During the show, host [[Alex Jones]] announced that Binney had been able to provide him with the actual memo, and the purported leaked document was shown on air.https://www.cnn.com/2018/02/02/politics/fbi-nunes-memo-full/index.html However, this was in fact a public document that had been available on the website of the [[Director of National Intelligence|Office of the Director of National Intelligence]] since at least May 2017.http://www.weeklystandard.com/fact-check-did-infowars-release-the-secret-fisa-memo/article/2011273https://www.wired.com/story/release-the-memo-nunes-fisa-702/ The actual Nunes memo was released
